title: Keep Pets Warm Indoors
tips: Make sure your pet has a cozy sleeping area away from cold floors and drafts. Use blankets or a soft bed to help them stay warm.

title: Protect Their Paws
tips: Clean your pet’s paws after walks to remove salt or ice. Consider using pet-safe booties or paw balm to prevent cracks and irritation.

title: Dress for the Weather
tips: Short-haired pets or small breeds may need a sweater or coat when going outside. Make sure it fits comfortably and doesn’t restrict movement.

title: Limit Outdoor Time
tips: Avoid keeping pets outdoors for long periods in freezing weather. Keep walks short and dry them off as soon as you come back inside.

title: Keep Water from Freezing
tips: Always provide fresh, unfrozen water. Use a heated water bowl or change the water often to keep your pet hydrated during cold days.

title: Watch for Frostbite and Hypothermia
tips: Check your pet’s ears, tail, and paws for pale or cold skin. If you notice shivering, weakness, or lethargy, warm them up and call your vet.
